page.title: 01LANDSCAPE AND BUILDINGS
page.content: The area surveyed is largely rural with rolling countryside divided into fields by Cornish stone hedges and areas of woodland. It contains the small villages of Crowntown, Carleen,Godolphin Cross and Nancegollan. The main activity of the area is farming. In the 18th and 19th Century the area was heavily lndustrialised by tin and copper mining but only the abandoned engine houses remain as silent witnesses to a bygone age. The housing of the area varies from granite-built cottages to modern bungalow estates.
